Package moteur.strategy

Class faceUpTheFirst

  • java.lang.Object
    • moteur.strategy.faceUpTheFirst
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Strategy
    public class faceUpTheFirst
extends java.lang.Object
implements Strategy
    This is an implementation of Strategy as well as the Design Pattern "Stragety". According to the level of difficulity chosen before the game starts, a virtuel player will call the corresponding methode to finish the operation.

    Here the strategy corresponds to the level 1, facile.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      faceUpTheFirst()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void makeOffer​(Player playerOwn)
      Aims to choose one card face up, this methode will choose the first card.
      void takeOffer​(Player playerOwn)
      This strategy does not need to realize the methode to take an offer, but due to the interface Strategy it implements, it should implement the inherited abstract methode.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • faceUpTheFirst

        public faceUpTheFirst()

    • Method Detail

      • makeOffer

        public void makeOffer​(Player playerOwn)
        Aims to choose one card face up, this methode will choose the first card. So it calls directly the methode player.chooseOneFaceup(0). Regardeless to the value nor the color of the card.
        Specified by:
        makeOffer in interface Strategy
        Parameters:
        playerOwn - who is to do the decision

      • takeOffer

        public void takeOffer​(Player playerOwn)
        This strategy does not need to realize the methode to take an offer, but due to the interface Strategy it implements, it should implement the inherited abstract methode.
        Specified by:
        takeOffer in interface Strategy
        Parameters:
        playerOwn - is a player, no matter virtual or real.
